<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 2"
    pfs=""
>
[False Flayleaf](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1714)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Alchemical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=6" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Inhaled" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=96" />
<trait label="Poison" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=126" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Travel Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=141) pg. 98</row>

**Price** 5 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Two Actions" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This poisonous plant is nearly identical in appearance to flayleaf. Unlike its [namesake](/Equipment.aspx?ID=624), it has a smooth leaf and pale white veins. Adventurous foragers should beware its effects.

**Saving Throw** DC 19 Fortitude; **Onset** 10 minutes; **Maximum Duration** 30 minutes; **Stage 1** dazzled (10 minutes); **Stage 2** 1d6 poison damage and [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (10 minutes); **Stage 3** 1d6 poison damage, [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5), and sickened 1 (1 minute)

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: False Flayleaf
